p: Lysosomes and cathepsins play a pivotal role in cancer cell death 45. The lysosomal permeabilization facilitates cathepsin release, causing cell death via mitochondria-dependent apoptosis 46. Among the lysosomal enzymes, cathepsin B is a cysteine protease mainly involved in the degradation or processing of lysosomal proteins 47, vesicle trafficking 48, cell death 49. Our findings revealed that level of cathepsin B was significantly reduced in response to TNFα, suggesting that inhibition of lysosomal cell death may involve in the prosurvival signals evoked by TNFα in HepG2 cells.
